turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of the Jews in Greater Cleveland.
turn.1: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.2: ONR BBYO has been a staple of Jewish teens in the area since the 1930s, and since then has grown to the size it is today.
turn.3: What is the size it is today?
turn.4: ONR has approximately 600 members, with which they hold several annual conventions with the entire region.
turn.6: The Ohio Northern Region, based in Cleveland but also branched in Akron/Canton, Toledo, and Youngstown, have 17 different AZA and BBG Chapters.
turn.8: There are 9 ONR Chapters in Greater Cleveland. Camp Wise is a Jewish summer camp located east of Cleveland in Chardon.
turn.9: What do the people do at Camp Wise?
turn.10: Since 1907, Camp Wise has been the summer home to hundreds of Jewish kids and teens from grades 2-10 every year.
turn.11: Is it open to the public?
turn.12: Though the camp serves mostly campers from Cleveland, campers as well as counselors from around the world attend.
